description: Serverless Workflow specification - Various workflow rate limiting settings

workflowid.description: Workflow definition unique identifier (workflow id property)

workflowVersions.description: Workflow versions. If not defined, applies to all workflow instances (regardless of their associated workflow version)

singleInstance.description: Rate Limit settings per single instance of a workflow with provided workflowid

allInstances.description: Rate Limit settings across all instance of a workflow with provided workflowid

maxActionsPerSecond.description: Sets the rate limiting on number of actions that can be executed per second. Notice that the number is represented as number type, so that you can set it to less than 1 if needed. For example, set the number to 0.1 means workflow actions can be executed once every 10 seconds. Default zero value means 'unlimited'

maxConcurrentActions.description: Maximum number of actions that can be executed in parallel

maxProducedEventsPerSecond.description: Sets the rate limiting on number of events that can be produced per second. Notice that the number is represented as number type, so that you can set it to less than 1 if needed. For example, set the number to 0.1 means workflow can produce events once every 10 seconds. Default zero value means 'unlimited'

maxStates.description: Maximum number of workflow states that should be executed. Default is zero, meaning unlimited.

maxTransitions.description: Maximum number of workflow transitions that should be executed. Default is zero, meaning unlimited.
